alert.note: Alert for Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 08 at 3:01PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Strong Cold Front Moving Across Eastern Interior Today... A strong cold front is moving across the Eastern Interior this morning. This front is causing periods of light snow and west winds of 15 mph gusting to 25 mph in many areas. This front is also bringing much cooler temperatures to the Interior. Highs today should be in the teens and lower 20s. The only 30s today are expected near Eagle. Alaska Range Passes, Eagle Summits and the Alaska Highway from Delta Junction east will see northwest winds gusting 30 to 40 mph and blowing snow through tonight. Conditions will clear and winds will decrease west of Fairbanks this evening, in Fairbanks late tonight, and along the Alaska Range and ALCAN Border early Saturday. Temperatures will moderate into the 20s and lower 30s on Saturday, and rise into the 30s on Sunday. Next week will see a return of warm temperatures.
